comment.text: Issues with aggregate graphs appearing on tree, plus time view of aggregate graphs on this version

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12927 cacti: cross-site scripting vulnerability in spikekill.php

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12927 cacti: cross-site scripting vulnerability in spikekill.php

long_desc.thetext:
A cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in Cacti 1.1.17 in the
method parameter in spikekill.php.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/issues/907

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/commit/a032ce0be6a4ea47862c594e40a619ac8de1ef99

Created cacti tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1484852]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1484851]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

comment.text: Issues with aggregate graphs appearing on tree, plus time view of aggregate graphs on this version

bugs.title: CVE-2017-12978 cacti: cross-site scripting vulnerability in lib/html.php

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-12978 cacti: cross-site scripting vulnerability in lib/html.php

long_desc.thetext:
lib/html.php in Cacti before 1.1.18 has XSS via the title field of an
external link added by an authenticated user.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/issues/918

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/Cacti/cacti/commit/9c610a7a4e29595dcaf7d7082134e4b89619ea24

Created cacti tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1484852]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1484851]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

lib/html.php in Cacti before 1.1.18 has XSS via the title field of an
external link added by an authenticated user.

Upstream bug:

Created cacti tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1484852]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1484851]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1484847,1484850

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
cacti-1.1.19-1.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-c28c0c3e0c
cacti-1.1.19-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-9a8c22eb51
cacti-1.1.19-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
cacti-1.1.19-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by mstevens.
This update has obsoleted [cacti-1.1.17-1.el6](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-86863120da), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has reached 14 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes

This update has been pushed to stable.
